title: Latest ET Manufacturing | Latest Manufacturing News : ETManufacturing.in

items.title: AstraZeneca's $50B US Manufacturing Push Amid Tariffs
items.summary:
- AstraZeneca plans a *$50 billion investment* in the US, driven by tariff pressures.
- A new manufacturing facility in Virginia marks the company's largest US investment to date.
- This shift reflects a wider industry trend as pharmaceutical firms move operations to reduce import reliance amid potential tariffs of up to *200%*.

items.title: Maruti Suzuki launches 4th Japan-India institute for manufacturing in Sonipat
items.summary:
- Maruti Suzuki has launched its fourth *Japan-India Institute for Manufacturing* (JIM) in Sonipat, focusing on skill development for over 100 students annually.
- The institute will offer courses in key trades and follows a dual training system integrating theoretical and hands-on learning, accredited by NCVT and Japan's METI.
- This initiative is part of a *public-private partnership*, contributing to *Haryana's* economic growth and employing a disciplined work ethic based on *Japanese manufacturing practices*.

items.title: Why Manufacturers with Multi-Plant Operations Need IoT
items.author: Hina Gupta, ETManufacturing
items.summary:
- *Energy costs* and **ESG reporting** are becoming increasingly critical for manufacturers.
- IoT provides a *centralized view* and control of multi-plant operations, enabling real-time data tracking and predictive maintenance.
- Transitioning to IoT solutions can enhance operational efficiency and compliance without substantial capital expenditures.

items.title: Inside the brain of a smart helmet
items.author: Kausthub Kaundinya, ETManufacturing
items.summary:
- *Smart helmets* utilize advanced sensors and IoT technology to enhance *worker safety* in high-risk environments.
- They provide real-time data on situational awareness, track movements, and monitor environmental hazards to proactively prevent accidents.
- The integration of various data sources improves compliance and offers legal protections, representing a significant cultural shift in workplace safety.

items.title: AIFI and Bureau of Energy Efficiency sign MoU
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- The *Association of Indian Forging Industry* (AIFI) partnered with the *Bureau of Energy Efficiency* (BEE) to promote *energy-efficient technologies*.
- The MoU supports *MSMEs* in energy-intensive sectors, facilitating *financial incentives* for adopting new technologies.
- Expected investment under the ADEETIE scheme is over ₹9,000 crore, enhancing industry sustainability and productivity.

items.title: Maruti Suzuki Opens Japan-India Manufacturing Institute
items.author: ETAuto Desk
items.summary:
- Maruti Suzuki has started admissions for its fourth *Japan-India Institute for Manufacturing (JIM)* in Sonipat, Haryana.
- The institute will enroll over 100 students annually in four trades, with classes commencing in September 2025.
- Supported by the Haryana government, this initiative is part of a broader effort to train 30,000 youths in manufacturing through a 2016 bilateral agreement with Japan.

items.title: Safran Completes Acquisition of Collins Aerospace
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- Safran has completed its acquisition of **Collins Aerospace**’s flight control and actuation operations for $1.8 billion, enhancing its global presence in the aerospace sector.
- This deal will allow for integration under **Safran Electronics & Defense** starting August 1, 2025, benefiting from a combined workforce of around 4,000 and projected revenues of $1.55 billion in 2024.
- The acquisition supports advancements in **next-generation aircraft** designs and strengthens Safran’s portfolio in civil, military, and rotorcraft applications.

items.title: Arunachal to get India's first fully indigenous 50-kw geothermal power plant
items.summary:
- India's first fully *indigenous* geothermal power plant will be established in Arunachal Pradesh with a capacity of **50-kw**.
- The project, *catering to over 5,000* people, is set to be completed in three years at a cost exceeding **Rs 10 crore**.
- Developed in collaboration with the **Ministry of New and Renewable Energy**, it aims to *lead India's clean energy revolution*.

items.title: MP, Rajasthan to modernise historic hydel stations with ₹1,000 crore green energy push
items.summary:
- The *Governments of Madhya Pradesh and Rajasthan* are investing over **₹1,000 crore** to modernise aging hydroelectric stations (Gandhi Sagar and Rana Pratap Sagar).  
- The projects aim to boost *renewable energy output* and restore efficiency, ultimately generating nearly **290 MW of clean electricity**.  
- This initiative represents a significant step in enhancing **infrastructure resilience** and promoting *sustainable power* across the region.

items.title: 34 Crore Jobs Created in MSMEs: Union Minister
items.summary:
- More than *34 crore jobs* have been created in **MSMEs** since 2014 through initiatives like the *Udyam portal*.
- The Indian government is focused on revamping MSME policies to foster *inclusive growth* and ease access to loans.
- A recent report by **NITI Aayog** suggests *targeted reforms* to unlock the potential of MSMEs, emphasizing their role in economic growth.

items.title: Mobile Production in India: Significant Growth
items.summary:
- Mobile production in India surged by *146%* to ₹5.25 lakh crore over four fiscal years.
- Exports skyrocketed by *775%*, reaching ₹2 lakh crore during the same period.
- Initiatives like the *PLI scheme* and *Make in India* are pivotal in boosting domestic manufacturing and reducing import dependency.

items.title: India’s data centre capacity to reach 5 GW by 2030
items.author: Saurav Anand, ETEnergyWorld
items.summary:
- India’s data centre capacity is projected to grow from *1.3 GW to 5 GW* by 2030.
- Capital expenditure is expected to *exceed $22 billion*, driven by strong investor interest and government support.
- Key cities for data centres include *Mumbai, Chennai, Delhi NCR, and Bengaluru*, with emerging locations like Ahmedabad and Lucknow gaining traction.

items.title: Nayara Energy to invest ₹70,000 cr in India; says EU sanctions go against India's interests
India’s smartphone shipments rebound in Q2
items.author: Subhrojit Mallick, ET Bureau
items.summary:
Key highlights from Q2 2025 include:
- A *7% on-year* and *21% sequential* increase in smartphone shipments, totaling 39 million units.
- Recovery driven by *new launches* and inventory management despite persistently low *organic demand*.
- Brands like *Vivo* and *Oppo* led growth, while *Apple* also gained traction with the iPhone 16's performance.

items.title: Serentica Renewables to procure wind turbines from SANY
items.summary:
- *Serentica Renewables* has announced its procurement of Wind Turbine Generators from **SANY Renewable** for a 336 MW project in Karnataka.
- The project will include advanced turbines with a rated capacity of 4 MW, aimed at reducing *carbon emissions* and providing renewable energy.
- This collaboration reflects a commitment to support India's renewable energy targets and promote a low-carbon economy.

items.title: Juniper Green Energy Commissions Additional Solar Capacity
items.summary:
- Juniper Green Energy has commissioned an *additional 43 MWp* solar capacity in Wardha, Maharashtra.
- This completes the *103 MWp* solar component of a *129 MWp hybrid power project*, finished ahead of schedule.
- The project strengthens India's *renewable energy* initiatives and responds to the growing demand for clean energy.

items.title: IISc’s Agri-Waste Hydrogen Breakthrough for a Fuel Future
items.author: Saurav Anand
items.summary:
- **IISc Bengaluru** developed a process to produce *99% pure green hydrogen* from agricultural waste, generating **5 kg/hour**.
- The project aims to address the **transition** from fossil fuel-derived hydrogen to sustainable energy sources in India.
- This innovative system captures carbon and supports the **National Hydrogen Energy Roadmap** while reducing environmental impact.

items.title: Rare earths shortage hits Foxconn unit; Apple AirPods production in India faces hurdles
items.author: Suraksha P, ETtech
items.summary:
- Production of Apple *AirPods* at Foxconn's Telangana plant is affected by a shortage of *dysprosium*, due to China's export restrictions on rare earth metals.
- *Foxconn* has engaged with the Telangana government to expedite certification for imports, but approval from the Chinese government is still pending.
- The situation reflects broader supply chain challenges as China's export controls impact not only electronics but also industries like *automotive* and defense.

items.title: Dedicated Electronics Components Manufacturing Policy Soon
items.summary:
- *Andhra Pradesh* is creating a dedicated policy for **electronics components manufacturing** aligned with the *Make in India* initiative.
- The policy aims to attract **$100 billion** in investments and reduce electronics imports by boosting domestic production.
- Chief Minister *N Chandrababu Naidu* emphasized the importance of creating a conducive ecosystem to support large-scale manufacturing industries.

items.title: RENK opens manufacturing facility in India
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- RENK Group has inaugurated a new manufacturing facility in Shoolagiri, India, to enhance its role in the *defence* and industrial sectors.
- The facility will produce *gear units*, gearboxes, and couplings, adopting a ‘local-for-local’ strategy to cater to domestic demands.
- This expansion positions RENK India as a vital part of the company's global operations and strengthens its involvement in Indian *defence projects*.

items.title: Union minister Pralhad Joshi flags off 435MW solar project
items.summary:
- Union minister *Pralhad Joshi* inaugurated the 435-MW *Gorbea Solar Power Project* in Rajasthan.
- The project, spanning 1,250 acres, enhances Rajasthan's renewable energy capacity, with 70% sourced from renewables.
- Farmers benefit from land leases, becoming *energy providers*, supported by significant investments in green energy policies.

items.title: MCD to roll out first of three biogas plants, boosting urban waste management
L&T to set up India's largest green hydrogen plant
items.summary:
- **Larsen & Toubro** will establish India's largest *green hydrogen plant* at the **Indian Oil Corporation's** *Panipat Refinery* in Haryana.
- The plant will produce **10,000 tonnes of green hydrogen per year** for 25 years, supporting the *National Green Hydrogen Mission*.
- This initiative aims to **decarbonise** IOCL's operations and align with India's *net zero* goals, reinforcing L&T's commitment to *clean energy solutions*.

items.title: Jharkhand’s Steel MSMEs Risk Missing Green Transition
items.author: Saurav Anand
items.summary:
- Jharkhand's MSMEs are struggling to decarbonize, facing *financial and technological barriers*.
- Large steel players are advancing towards *lower emissions*, leaving smaller firms at risk of closing.
- A proposed Green Financing Facility could support MSMEs in this *crucial transition* to ensure job protection and regional sustainability.

items.title: Naidu Pushes for Electronics Manufacturing Boost
items.summary:
- Andhra Pradesh CM *N Chandrababu Naidu* emphasizes boosting **electronics manufacturing** to meet *global demand*.
- The state aims for *self-reliance* and *significant investment*, targeting USD 100 billion in the next five years.
- Naidu highlights the need for **skill development** and urban employment opportunities to support the growing electronics sector.

items.title: UltraTech Cement Expansion Plans by FY27
items.summary:
- *UltraTech Cement* plans to expand its capacity by 29 MTPA across India, reaching a total of 212.2 MTPA by FY27.
- The growth will be realized through *greenfield and brownfield projects* in five zones, with significant contributions from new units in various states.
- This expansion is in response to projected *7-8% growth* in cement demand driven by infrastructure development and favorable market conditions.

items.title: MediaTek's Opportunity in Indian EV Market
items.summary:
- MediaTek aims to leverage India's vast *AI talent pool* and the eagerness of *electric vehicle makers* to adopt advanced technology.
- Key shifts include the demand for *AI adoption*, high-performance computing, and *energy efficiency* for EVs.
- The company plans to offer customized solutions and drive the adoption of *AI-enabled chips* across different vehicle segments.

items.title: India to Support Chinese Investment with Technology Transfer
items.summary:
* The Indian government is open to *Chinese investments* in the electronics sector, contingent on joint ventures and *technology transfer*.  
* Efforts aim to enhance *domestic capabilities*, targeting over 30% local value addition in electronics within a few years.  
* Recent trade relations have been tense, with *China imposing informal restrictions* that threaten India's smartphone export goals.

items.title: Andhra govt unveils plan for India’s largest green hydrogen ecosystem
items.summary:
- The *Andhra Pradesh government* has launched the 'Green Hydrogen Valley' initiative to promote India's largest *green hydrogen* ecosystem.
- This initiative aims to boost *domestic R&D*, build infrastructure, and establish testing facilities for green hydrogen technologies.
- Key goals include *2 GW electrolyser manufacturing capacity by 2027* and producing *1.5 million metric tonnes* of green hydrogen annually by 2029.

items.title: NTPC REL Signs Agreement for Renewable Projects in Goa
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- NTPC REL has signed an MoU with GEDA to develop *300 MW* of renewable energy projects in Goa.
- The projects will focus on *solar and hybrid energy* solutions, potentially integrating *energy storage systems*.
- This partnership aligns with NTPC's objective to *boost clean energy* in its portfolio and support state renewable energy efforts.

items.title: Union minister flags off 435MW solar project
items.summary:
- *Pralhad Joshi*, the Union Minister for New and Renewable Energy, inaugurated the **435-MW Gorbea Solar Power Project** in Rajasthan, developed by Zelestra India.
- The project covers *1,250 acres* and is backed by a 25-year power agreement, contributing to Rajasthan's dominance in renewable energy with *over 35.4 GW* installed capacity.
- Joshi emphasized the role of *farmers* as energy providers through land leasing, supporting a new integrated clean energy policy and significant investment commitments in renewable energy.

items.title: Patel Engineering secures ₹240-cr order from NHPC
items.summary:
- *Patel Engineering* has won a ₹240 crore order from *NHPC* for the *Teesta-V project* in *Sikkim*.
- The project involves *civil and hydro mechanical works*, including modifications for a spillway arrangement.
- Completion is expected within 18 months, leveraging Patel's extensive experience in the region.

items.title: Reliance's Green Energy Expansion Sparks Analyst Optimism
items.summary:
- Reliance Industries is rapidly progressing on its $10 billion clean energy investment, aiming for *net-zero carbon emissions* by 2035.
- Analysts are optimistic about the potential of Reliance's new energy segment to become a key growth driver, with significant *solar solutions* and *battery manufacturing* efforts.
- Despite this optimism, near-term challenges include global solar overcapacity and potential U.S. trade impacts on Indian exports.

items.title: ZYOD Expands Production Capacity in Gurugram
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- ZYOD opened its largest facility in Gurugram, spanning over *1 lakh square feet* and housing over *750 machines*.
- The factory aims for an annual output of *60 lakh garments*, utilizing *IoT technology* and automated processes to enhance efficiency.
- This expansion will create *over 2,000 jobs* and strengthen partnerships with major retailers like **Marks & Spencer** and **Walmart**.

items.title: ADB grants ₹975 cr for Tripura's industrial infrastructure
items.summary:
- The *Asian Development Bank* has sanctioned a loan of ₹975.26 crore for infrastructure development in nine industrial areas of *Tripura*. 
- Projects include construction of *industrial sheds*, roadways, power substations, and fire service stations.
- Initiatives to boost the *plywood industry* and rehabilitation of mature rubber plantations are also underway, enhancing local economic opportunities.

items.title: India installs record 22 GW renewable capacity in H1 2025
items.author: Saurav Anand
items.summary:
* India achieved a record *22 GW* of renewable energy capacity in the first half of 2025, with *18.4 GW* from solar sources.
* The growth is attributed to developers taking advantage of a *waiver on interstate transmission charges* set to phase out by 2028.
* Despite the increase in renewables, *coal remains predominant* in India’s power generation, posing challenges to achieving net-zero goals.

items.title: Solar Energy Roofing on Public Sports Fields
items.summary:
- The Israeli government has allocated **34 million Shekels** ($10 million) for installing *solar energy roofing* on public sports fields.
- This initiative will enhance **energy security**, provide shade, and combat the *urban heat island effect*.
- The project supports Israel's goal of achieving **30% renewable energy by 2030** and aims to utilize existing infrastructure effectively.

items.title: Purabi Dairy set to double its processing capacity to 3 lakh litres per day
items.author: Bikash Singh, ET Bureau
items.summary:
- Purabi Dairy is expanding its processing capacity from 1.5 lakh to **3 lakh litres** per day to enhance milk production.
- The **Rs 104 crore** project aligns with Assam's dairy development strategy, aiming for improved rural livelihoods.
- The facility will also include new **ice cream production** capabilities and increase overall operational efficiency.

items.title: L&T to set up India's largest green hydrogen plant
items.summary:
- *Larsen & Toubro (L&T)* will establish the largest **green hydrogen plant** in India at IOCL's *Panipat Refinery*.
- The project will support the *National Green Hydrogen Mission*, aiming to make India a global leader in green hydrogen.
- The plant will provide **10,000 tonnes of green hydrogen annually** to IOCL for 25 years, contributing to decarbonisation efforts.

items.title: India's smartphone shipments jump 22% in Q2
items.author: Romit Guha, ET Bureau
items.summary:
**Key Highlights:**
- *Smartphone shipments in India increased by 22%* in Q2 FY25 compared to the previous quarter, bouncing back from two quarters of decline.
- Major contributions came from brands like *Vivo and Oppo*, which saw double-digit growth due to new affordable models and online sales.
- Despite challenges like climate disruptions and geopolitical tensions, *39 million shipments* were recorded due to preparedness for the upcoming festive season.

items.title: ADIA to invest $200 million in Gujarat-based medtech co Meril
items.summary:
- The *Abu Dhabi Investment Authority (ADIA)* will invest **$200 million** in Indian medtech company *Meril* for a nearly **3% stake**.
- This investment values Meril at *$6.6 billion*, enhancing ADIA's footprint in India’s **medical devices market**.
- Meril, founded by the *Bilakhia Group*, specializes in innovative healthcare solutions, exporting to over **150 countries**.

items.title: India Manufacturing First Commercial-Scale Semiconductor Chip
items.summary:
- India will produce its first *commercial-scale* semiconductor chip this year.
- IIT-Hyderabad students designed 20 chipsets, with eight progressing to the final design stage.
- The initiative aims to establish India as one of the top-5 *semiconductor* nations globally, boosting electronics manufacturing and exports.

items.title: Sona Comstar Joint Venture for EV Components in China
items.summary:
- *Sona Comstar* has partnered with *Jinnaite Machinery Co* to create a joint venture in *China* for manufacturing *driveline systems*.
- The venture involves an investment of $12 million from Sona Comstar, aiming to enhance its presence in the global *EV market*.
- Operations are set to begin in the second half of the financial year, aiming to leverage China's substantial *electric vehicle* opportunities.

items.title: China Electronics Entry May Hinge on Tech Transfer JVs
items.summary:
- The Indian government may support *Chinese investments* in electronics if they involve *joint ventures* and *technology transfer*.
- The Ministry of Electronics and IT emphasizes that such partnerships are crucial for India's manufacturing capabilities.
- Ongoing trade tensions and China's restrictions on exports could impact the *competitiveness* of India's electronics industry.

items.title: China Electronics Entry May Hinge on Tech Transfer JVs
items.author: Kiran Rathee, ET Bureau
items.summary:
- The Indian government may support *Chinese investments* in electronics through *joint ventures with Indian firms* that include *technology transfer*.
- Approval for such partnerships is crucial for boosting local manufacturing and achieving *higher local value addition* in electronics products.
- The rise in smartphone manufacturing in India highlights the need for Chinese expertise as domestic firms face challenges from *China's informal trade barriers* and restrictions on rare earth materials.

items.title: Govt, corporates settle tax row over factories in hilly regions
JSW Steel to invest ₹20,000 crore in Dolvi expansion
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- JSW Steel plans to invest *₹20,000 crore* primarily in expanding the Dolvi plant capacity from *10 million tonnes to 15 million tonnes* by September 2027.
- This capital expenditure is *19% higher* than the previous fiscal year’s spending, with most funding coming from *internal accruals*.
- The company aims for a target of *50 million tonnes annual production* by FY31, mainly through brownfield projects.

items.title: 1,190 MW Decentralised Solar Plants Installed in Rajasthan
items.summary:
- **1,190 MW** of *decentralised solar plants* were installed in Rajasthan under the **PM-KUSUM scheme** last year. 
- This initiative empowers farmers by enabling them to become *power producers* and offers low-cost electricity at **₹2.09-3 per unit**. 
- The state's goal is to provide daytime electricity for agriculture to all farmers by **2027**, aiming to significantly reduce *discom losses* exceeding ₹90,000 crore.

items.title: China's rare earth magnet exports to the US surge 660% in June
items.summary:
- China's rare earth magnet exports to the US skyrocketed by **660%** in June compared to May, with shipments reaching **353 metric tons**.
- This increase follows agreements to address previous trade barriers, particularly impacting industries reliant on these minerals like *electric vehicles* and *wind turbines*.
- Despite this surge, overall exports in the first half of 2025 declined **18.9%** from the previous year.

items.title: Rare earth magnet for ecocide in Myanmar
items.author: Dipanjan Roy Chaudhury, ET Bureau
items.summary:
- *Rare earth mining* in Myanmar's Kachin State is causing **severe environmental damage** and violating *human rights*.
- Local communities are heavily impacted, facing *polluted water* and loss of traditional livelihoods while receiving little compensation.
- Despite the substantial profits made by armed groups, the government benefits minimally, with most mining being *unregulated*.
